item.title: 8 decades later, remains of a Virginia sailor killed in Pearl Harbor are identified
item.description: David Walker from Norfolk, Va., was 19 years old when Japanese torpedoes sunk his battleship, the USS California, during the surprise attack on the Hawaii naval base in 1941.

item.title: Millions of customers' data found on dark web in latest AT&T data breach
item.description: The provider says it has reset the passcodes of the current account holders whose data was compromised as it investigates the leak, the latest in a string of telecommunications company data breaches.

item.title: California fast-food workers will get $20 minimum wage, starting Monday
item.description: Debate is hot about the impact of a higher minimum wage. Half a million Californians work in fast-food, where wages had stagnated for decades. Restaurant owners warn of higher prices and fewer hours.

item.title: Climate change is delaying world clocks' need for a 'negative leap second'
item.description: We're nearing a year when a negative leap second could be needed to shave time — an unprecedented step that would have unpredictable effects, a new study says.

item.title: Trans Day of Visibility began 15 years ago. The founder is still moved by its success
item.description: Rachel Crandall-Crocker, the founder of International Transgender Day of Visibility, said organizing has taught her one invaluable lesson: "You do not have to be perfect to change the world."

item.title: From longshoremen to charter boats, Baltimore's port closure means lost work
item.description: The Port of Baltimore, normally one of the country's busiest, is in limbo due to the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge. For those who work on the water, business is far from usual.

item.title: A cancer diagnosis is a shock. Here's advice on how to share the news
item.description: The secrecy that shrouded Princess Kate's cancer diagnosis is something that any new cancer patient can understand. It's daunting to decide when to share, whom to tell and how much to say.

item.title: 21 years after her death in Gaza, Palestinians remember U.S. activist Rachel Corrie
item.description: The 23-year-old was crushed by an Israeli army bulldozer as she protested the demolition of homes in Gaza in 2003. Her memory remains cherished among Palestinians, including the family she lived with.
